content: Oftentimes people will file issues to rust-lang/rust that should be destined to other repositories in rust-lang. Is there any way perhaps to set up repositories so that a person doesn't need some sort of a write permission in the target repository in order to move an issue to it?
In retrospective this should've been a #t-infra thread, but I can't move it ^^

@nagisa Unfortunately GitHub requires "write" permission in both repositories to transfer. I transfer things when I can, but there are several repos I don't have access to that would be nice to transfer things to.
Maybe rustbot can do that? Something like @rustbot move rust-lang/repo_name (only people with r+ rights).
That seems like a good idea. You'd still want to make sure someone had appropriate permissions in both repositories, but they wouldn't need direct-write permission.
This topic was moved here from #general > ability to move issues around? by Josh Triplett
